Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: 1. This Regulation lays down:

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (a) conditions for the re-use, within the Union, of certain categories of data held by public sector bodies;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (b) a notification and supervisory framework for the provision of data intermediation services;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (c) a framework for voluntary registration of entities which collect and process data made available for altruistic purposes; and

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (d) a framework for the establishment of a European Data Innovation Board.

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: 2. This Regulation does not create any obligation on public sector bodies to allow the re-use of data, nor does it release public sector bodies from their confidentiality obligations under

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: obligations under Union or national law.

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: This Regulation is without prejudice to:

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (a) specific provisions in Union or national law regarding the access to or re-use of certain categories of data, in particular with regard to the granting of access to and disclosure of

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: access to and disclosure of official documents; and

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (b) the obligations of public sector bodies under Union or national law to allow the re-use of data or to requirements related to processing of non-personal data.

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: Where sector-specific Union or national law requires public sector bodies, data intermediation services providers or recognised data altruism organisations to comply with specific additional

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: with specific additional technical, administrative or organisational requirements, including through an authorisation or certification regime, those provisions of that sector-specific Union

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: of that sector-specific Union or national law shall also apply. Any such specific additional requirements shall be non-discriminatory, proportionate and objectively justified.

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: 3. Union and national law on the protection of personal data shall apply to any personal data processed in connection with this Regulation. In particular, this Regulation is without prejudice

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: is without prejudice to Regulations (EU) 2016/679 and (EU) 2018/1725 and Directives 2002/58/EC and (EU) 2016/680, including with regard to the powers and competences of supervisory authorities.

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: In the event of a conflict between this Regulation and Union law on the protection of personal data or national law adopted in accordance with such Union law, the relevant Union or national

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: relevant Union or national law on the protection of personal data shall prevail. This Regulation does not create a legal basis for the processing of personal data, nor does it affect any

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: data, nor does it affect any of the rights and obligations set out in Regulations (EU) 2016/679 or (EU) 2018/1725 or Directives 2002/58/EC or (EU) 2016/680.

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: 4. This Regulation is without prejudice to the application of competition law.

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: 5. This Regulation is without prejudice to the competences of the Member States with regard to their activities concerning public security, defence and national security.

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: For the purposes of this Regulation, the following definitions apply:

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (1)'data' means any digital representation of acts, facts or information and any compilation of such acts, facts or information, including in the form of sound, visual or audiovisual recording;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (2)'re-use' means the use by natural or legal persons of data held by public sector bodies, for commercial or non-commercial purposes other than the initial purpose within the public task

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: within the public task for which the data were produced, except for the exchange of data between public sector bodies purely in pursuit of their public tasks;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (3)'personal data' means personal data as defined in Article 4, point (1), of Regulation (EU) 2016/679;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (4)'non-personal data' means data other than personal data;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (5)'consent' means consent as defined in Article 4, point (11), of Regulation (EU) 2016/679;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (6)'permission' means giving data users the right to the processing of non-personal data;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (7)'data subject' means data subject as referred to in Article 4, point (1), of Regulation (EU) 2016/679;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (8)'data holder' means a legal person, including public sector bodies and international organisations, or a natural person who is not a data subject with respect to the specific data in

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: to the specific data in question, which, in accordance with applicable Union or national law, has the right to grant access to or to share certain personal data or non-personal data;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (9)'data user' means a natural or legal person who has lawful access to certain personal or non-personal data and has the right, including under Regulation (EU) 2016/679 in the case of

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (EU) 2016/679 in the case of personal data, to use that data for commercial or non-commercial purposes;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (10)'data sharing' means the provision of data by a data subject or a data holder to a data user for the purpose of the joint or individual use of such data, based on voluntary agreements

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: based on voluntary agreements or Union or national law, directly or through an intermediary, for example under open or commercial licences subject to a fee or free of charge;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (11)'data intermediation service' means a service which aims to establish commercial relationships for the purposes of data sharing between an undetermined number of data subjects and data

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: of data subjects and data holders on the one hand and data users on the other, through technical, legal or other means, including for the purpose of exercising the rights of data subjects

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: the rights of data subjects in relation to personal data, excluding at least the following:

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (a) services that obtain data from data holders and aggregate, enrich or transform the data for the purpose of adding substantial value to it and license the use of the resulting data to

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: use of the resulting data to data users, without establishing a commercial relationship between data holders and data users;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (b) services that focus on the intermediation of copyright-protected content;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (c) services that are exclusively used by one data holder in order to enable the use of the data held by that data holder, or that are used by multiple legal persons in a closed group,

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: persons in a closed group, including supplier or customer relationships or collaborations established by contract, in particular those that have as a main objective to ensure the functionalities

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: to ensure the functionalities of objects and devices connected to the Internet of Things;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (d) data sharing services offered by public sector bodies that do not aim to establish commercial relationships;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (12)'processing' means processing as defined in Article 4, point (2), of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 with regard to personal data or Article 3, point (2), of Regulation (EU) 2018/1807 with

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (EU) 2018/1807 with regard to non-personal data;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (13)'access' means data use, in accordance with specific technical, legal or organisational requirements, without necessarily implying the transmission or downloading of data;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (14)'main establishment' of a legal person means the place of its central administration in the Union;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (15)'services of data cooperatives' means data intermediation services offered by an organisational structure constituted by data subjects, one-person undertakings or SMEs who are members

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: or SMEs who are members of that structure, having as its main objectives to support its members in the exercise of their rights with respect to certain data, including with regard to making

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: with regard to making informed choices before they consent to data processing, to exchange views on data processing purposes and conditions that would best represent the interests of its

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: the interests of its members in relation to their data, and to negotiate terms and conditions for data processing on behalf of its members before giving permission to the processing of

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: to the processing of non-personal data or before they consent to the processing of personal data;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (16)'data altruism' means the voluntary sharing of data on the basis of the consent of data subjects to process personal data pertaining to them, or permissions of data holders to allow

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: of data holders to allow the use of their non-personal data without seeking or receiving a reward that goes beyond compensation related to the costs that they incur where they make their

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: incur where they make their data available for objectives of general interest as provided for in national law, where applicable, such as healthcare, combating climate change, improving

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: climate change, improving mobility, facilitating the development, production and dissemination of official statistics, improving the provision of public services, public policy making or

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: public policy making or scientific research purposes in the general interest;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (17)'public sector body' means the State, regional or local authorities, bodies governed by public law or associations formed by one or more such authorities, or one or more such bodies

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: or one or more such bodies governed by public law;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (18)'bodies governed by public law' means bodies that have the following characteristics:

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (a) they are established for the specific purpose of meeting needs in the general interest, and do not have an industrial or commercial character;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (b) they have legal personality;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (c) they are financed, for the most part, by the State, regional or local authorities, or other bodies governed by public law, are subject to management supervision by those authorities

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: by those authorities or bodies, or have an administrative, managerial or supervisory board, more than half of whose members are appointed by the State, regional or local authorities, or

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: or local authorities, or by other bodies governed by public law;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (19)'public undertaking' means any undertaking over which the public sector bodies may exercise directly or indirectly a dominant influence by virtue of their ownership of it, their financial

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: of it, their financial participation therein, or the rules which govern it; for the purposes of this definition, a dominant influence on the part of the public sector bodies shall be presumed

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: bodies shall be presumed in any of the following cases in which those bodies, directly or indirectly:

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (a) hold the majority of the undertaking' s subscribed capital;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (b) control the majority of the votes attaching to shares issued by the undertaking;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (c) can appoint more than half of the undertaking' s administrative, management or supervisory body;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (20)'secure processing environment' means the physical or virtual environment and organisational means to ensure compliance with Union law, such as Regulation (EU) 2016/679, in particular

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (EU) 2016/679, in particular with regard to data subjects'  rights, intellectual property rights, and commercial and statistical confidentiality, integrity and accessibility, as well as

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: and accessibility, as well as with applicable national law, and to allow the entity providing the secure processing environment to determine and supervise all data processing actions, including

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: processing actions, including the display, storage, download and export of data and the calculation of derivative data through computational algorithms;

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: (21)'legal representative' means a natural or legal person established in the Union explicitly designated to act on behalf of a data intermediation services provider or an entity that collects

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: or an entity that collects data for objectives of general interest made available by natural or legal persons on the basis of data altruism not established in the Union, which may be addressed

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: Union, which may be addressed by the competent authorities for data intermediation services and the competent authorities for the registration of data altruism organisations in addition

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: organisations in addition to or instead of the data intermediation services provider or entity with regard to the obligations under this Regulation, including with regard to initiating

Chapter: Chapter I: General provisions
Content: with regard to initiating enforcement proceedings against a non-compliant data intermediation services provider or entity not established in the Union.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 1. This Chapter applies to data held by public sector bodies which are protected on grounds of:

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: (a) commercial confidentiality, including business, professional and company secrets;

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: (b) statistical confidentiality;

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: (c) the protection of intellectual property rights of third parties; or

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: (d) the protection of personal data, insofar as such data fall outside the scope of Directive (EU) 2019/1024.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 2. This Chapter does not apply to:

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: (a) data held by public undertakings;

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: (b) data held by public service broadcasters and their subsidiaries, and by other bodies or their subsidiaries for the fulfilment of a public service broadcasting remit;

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: (c) data held by cultural establishments and educational establishments;

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: (d) data held by public sector bodies which are protected for reasons of public security, defence or national security; or

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: (e) data the supply of which is an activity falling outside the scope of the public task of the public sector bodies concerned as defined by law or by other binding rules in the Member

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: binding rules in the Member State concerned, or, in the absence of such rules, as defined in accordance with common administrative practice in that Member State, provided that the scope

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: provided that the scope of the public tasks is transparent and subject to review.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 3. This Chapter is without prejudice to:

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: (a) Union and national law and international agreements to which the Union or Member States are party on the protection of categories of data referred to in paragraph 1; and

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: (b) Union and national law on access to documents.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 1. Agreements or other practices pertaining to the re-use of data held by public sector bodies containing categories of data referred to in Article 3(1) which grant exclusive rights or

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: grant exclusive rights or which have as their objective or effect to grant such exclusive rights or to restrict the availability of data for re-use by entities other than the parties to

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: other than the parties to such agreements or other practices shall be prohibited.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 2. By way of derogation from paragraph 1, an exclusive right to re-use data referred to in that paragraph may be granted to the extent necessary for the provision of a service or the supply

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: of a service or the supply of a product in the general interest that would not otherwise be possible.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 3. An exclusive right as referred to in paragraph 2 shall be granted through an administrative act or contractual arrangement in accordance with applicable Union or national law and in

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: Union or national law and in compliance with the principles of transparency, equal treatment and non-discrimination.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 4. The duration of an exclusive right to re-use data shall not exceed 12 months. Where a contract is concluded, the duration of the contract shall be the same as the duration of the exclusive

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: the duration of the exclusive right.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 5. The grant of an exclusive right pursuant to paragraphs 2, 3 and 4, including the reasons as to why it is necessary to grant such a right, shall be transparent and be made publicly available

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: be made publicly available online, in a form that complies with relevant Union law on public procurement.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 6. Agreements or other practices falling within the scope of the prohibition referred to in paragraph 1 which do not meet the conditions laid down in paragraphs 2 and 3 and which were concluded

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 3 and which were concluded before 23 June 2022 shall be terminated at the end of the applicable contract and in any event by 24 December 2024.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 1. Public sector bodies which are competent under national law to grant or refuse access for the re-use of one or more of the categories of data referred to in Article 3(1) shall make publicly

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 3(1) shall make publicly available the conditions for allowing such re-use and the procedure to request the re-use via the single information point referred to in Article 8. Where they

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: to in Article 8. Where they grant or refuse access for re-use, they may be assisted by the competent bodies referred to in Article 7(1).

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: Member States shall ensure that public sector bodies are equipped with the necessary resources to comply with this Article.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 2. Conditions for re-use shall be non-discriminatory, transparent, proportionate and objectively justified with regard to the categories of data and the purposes of re-use and the nature

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: of re-use and the nature of the data for which re-use is allowed. Those conditions shall not be used to restrict competition.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 3. Public sector bodies shall, in accordance with Union and national law, ensure that the protected nature of data is preserved. They may provide for the following requirements:

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: (a) to grant access for the re-use of data only where the public sector body or the competent body, following the request for re-use, has ensured that data has been:

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: (i) anonymised, in the case of personal data; and

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: (ii) modified, aggregated or treated by any other method of disclosure control, in the case of commercially confidential information, including trade secrets or content protected by intellectual

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: protected by intellectual property rights;

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: (b) to access and re-use the data remotely within a secure processing environment that is provided or controlled by the public sector body;

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: (c) to access and re-use the data within the physical premises in which the secure processing environment is located in accordance with high security standards, provided that remote access

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: provided that remote access cannot be allowed without jeopardising the rights and interests of third parties.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 4. In the case of re-use allowed in accordance with paragraph 3, points (b) and (c), the public sector bodies shall impose conditions that preserve the integrity of the functioning of the

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: of the functioning of the technical systems of the secure processing environment used. The public sector body shall reserve the right to verify the process, the means and any results of

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: the means and any results of processing of data undertaken by the re-user to preserve the integrity of the protection of the data and reserve the right to prohibit the use of results that

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: the use of results that contain information jeopardising the rights and interests of third parties. The decision to prohibit the use of the results shall be comprehensible and transparent

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: and transparent to the re-user.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 5. Unless national law provides for specific safeguards on applicable confidentiality obligations relating to the re-use of data referred to in Article 3(1), the public sector body shall

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: the public sector body shall make the re-use of data provided in accordance with paragraph 3 of this Article conditional on the adherence by the re-user to a confidentiality obligation

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: a confidentiality obligation that prohibits the disclosure of any information that jeopardises the rights and interests of third parties that the re-user may have acquired despite the safeguards

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: despite the safeguards put in place.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: Re-users shall be prohibited from re-identifying any data subject to whom the data relates and shall take technical and operational measures to prevent re-identification and to notify any

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: and to notify any data breach resulting in the re-identification of the data subjects concerned to the public sector body. In the event of the unauthorised re-use of non-personal data,

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: re-use of non-personal data, the re-user shall, without delay, where appropriate with the assistance of the public sector body, inform the legal persons whose rights and interests may be

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: rights and interests may be affected.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 6. Where the re-use of data cannot be allowed in accordance with the obligations laid down in paragraphs 3 and 4 of this Article and there is no legal basis for transmitting the data under

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: transmitting the data under Regulation (EU) 2016/679, the public sector body shall make best efforts, in accordance with Union and national law, to provide assistance to potential re-users

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: to potential re-users in seeking consent of the data subjects or permission from the data holders whose rights and interests may be affected by such re-use, where it is feasible without

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: where it is feasible without a disproportionate burden on the public sector body. Where it provides such assistance, the public sector body may be assisted by the competent bodies referred

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: the competent bodies referred to in Article 7(1).

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 7. Re-use of data shall be allowed only in compliance with intellectual property rights. The right of the maker of a database as provided for in Article 7(1) of Directive 96/9/EC shall

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: of Directive 96/9/EC shall not be exercised by public sector bodies in order to prevent the re-use of data or to restrict re-use beyond the limits set by this Regulation.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 8. Where data requested is considered to be confidential, in accordance with Union or national law on commercial or statistical confidentiality, the public sector bodies shall ensure that

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: bodies shall ensure that the confidential data is not disclosed as a result of allowing re-use, unless such re-use is allowed in accordance with paragraph 6.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 9. Where a re-user intends to transfer non-personal data protected on the grounds set out in Article 3(1) to a third country, it shall inform the public sector body of its intention to

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: body of its intention to transfer such data and the purpose of such transfer at the time of requesting the re-use of such data.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: In the case of re-use in accordance with paragraph 6 of this Article, the re-user shall, where appropriate with the assistance of the public sector body, inform the legal person whose rights

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: the legal person whose rights and interests may be affected of that intention, purpose and the appropriate safeguards. The public sector body shall not allow the re-use unless the legal

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: the re-use unless the legal person gives permission for the transfer.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 10. Public sector bodies shall transmit non-personal confidential data or data protected by intellectual property rights to a re-user which intends to transfer those data to a third country

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: those data to a third country other than a country designated in accordance with paragraph 12 only if the re-user contractually commits to:

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: (a) complying with the obligations imposed in accordance with paragraphs 7 and 8 even after the data is transferred to the third country; and

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: (b) accepting the jurisdiction of the courts or tribunals of the Member State of the transmitting public sector body with regard to any dispute related to compliance with paragraphs 7 and

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 11. Public sector bodies shall, where relevant and to the extent of their capabilities, provide guidance and assistance to re-users in complying with the obligations referred to in paragraph

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: referred to in paragraph 10 of this Article.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: In order to assist public sector bodies and re-users, the Commission may adopt implementing acts establishing model contractual clauses for complying with the obligations referred to in

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: obligations referred to in paragraph 10 of this Article. Those implementing acts shall be adopted in accordance with the examination procedure referred to in Article 33(3).

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 12. Where justified because of the substantial number of requests across the Union concerning the re-use of non-personal data in specific third countries, the Commission may adopt implementing

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: may adopt implementing acts declaring that the legal, supervisory and enforcement arrangements of a third country:

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: (a) ensure protection of intellectual property and trade secrets in a way that is essentially equivalent to the protection ensured under Union law;

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: (b) are being effectively applied and enforced; and

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: (c) provide effective judicial redress.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: Those implementing acts shall be adopted in accordance with the examination procedure referred to in Article 33(3).

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: 13. Specific Union legislative acts may deem certain non-personal data categories held by public sector bodies to be highly sensitive for the purposes of this Article where their transfer

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: Article where their transfer to third countries may put at risk Union public policy objectives, such as safety and public health or may lead to the risk of re-identification of non-personal,

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: of non-personal, anonymised data. Where such an act is adopted, the Commission shall adopt delegated acts in accordance with Article 32 supplementing this Regulation by laying down special

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: by laying down special conditions applicable to the transfers of such data to third countries.

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: Those special conditions shall be based on the nature of the non-personal data categories identified in the specific Union legislative act and on the grounds for deeming those categories

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
Content: for deeming those categories to be highly sensitive, taking into account the risks of re-identification of non-personal, anonymised data. They shall be non-discriminatory and limited to

Chapter: Chapter II: Re-use of certain categories of protected data held by public sector bodies
